overview: The purpose of this measure is to appropriate funds for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative and to create the Supportive Housing Special Fund. [9] This fund is designed to assist the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation in facilitating the development of mixed-income rental housing projects for special needs individuals or families. [9] Your Committee on Finance is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, and recommends that it pass Third Reading. [9]
appropriations: This measure appropriates funds for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative. [9] It also establishes the Supportive Housing Special Fund to assist the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation. [9] The committee report does not specify any dollar amounts for these appropriations. [9] [9] [9] [9] [9] [9] [9] [9]
assumptions_and_methodology: The fiscal plan is based on the need to facilitate the development of mixed-income rental housing projects for special needs individuals or families who require supportive services. [9] The measure aims to create a dedicated financing tool, the Supportive Housing Special Fund, to address this need. [9] The measure also assumes the need for continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative. [9]
agency_impact: The Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation is tasked with administering the new Supportive Housing Special Fund. [9] The sums appropriated for the Kauhale Initiative shall be expended by the office of the governor. [9] The Committee on Finance received comments on this measure from the Department of Budget and Finance, Department of Human Services, State Procurement Office, and Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation. [9]
economic_impact: This measure aims to address housing insecurity by creating a Supportive Housing Special Fund to facilitate the development of mixed-income rental housing projects. [9] It also provides continued funding for the Kauhale Initiative. [9] Testimony in support was received from numerous community and government organizations, reflecting broad support for addressing housing needs. [9] [9] [9]
policy_impact: This measure creates the Supportive Housing Special Fund to assist the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation. [9] It also appropriates funds for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative. [9] The bill modifies state housing policy by establishing a new dedicated fund for supportive housing projects. [9]
revenue_sources: The measure appropriates funds, implying a general fund source for the Kauhale Initiative and the initial capitalization of the Supportive Housing Special Fund. [9] The Supportive Housing Special Fund is structured to facilitate development of rental housing projects, though the specifics of its revenue sources are not detailed in the committee report. [9] Testimony was received from a wide range of organizations in support of the measure. [9] [9]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The measure appropriates unspecified funds for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative. [9] It also creates the Supportive Housing Special Fund to facilitate the development of mixed-income rental housing projects. [9] Since the appropriations are unspecified, the precise multi-year fiscal impact cannot be determined from the committee report. [9] The establishment of a permanent special fund suggests an ongoing fiscal commitment to supportive housing. [9] This fund would support projects for special needs individuals or families who require supportive services. [9] Continued operation of the Kauhale Initiative will also likely require future appropriations. [9] The Committee on Finance is in accord with the intent and purpose of the measure. [9] However, no specific long-term cost projections are provided in the documentation. [9] [9] [9] [9] [9] [9] [9] [9] The bill, H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, will be forwarded for Third Reading. [9] No other fiscal implications are detailed. [9]
